p: The anti-elastase activity of Plectranthus spp. organic extracts ( Figure 6(A)) revealed impaired elastase inhibition, in contrast to the previous enzymatic assays regarding tyrosinase and collagenase inhibitory activity. Under the experimental conditions, the maximum elastase inhibition obtained was 42.8 4.2% for P. grandidentatus ethyl acetic extract, while the positive control, ursolic acid, inhibited elastase by 69.9 3.7%. The organic extracts from P. madagascariensis and the acetonic extract from P. grandidentatus showed no elastase inhibition ( p > 0.05).
